**Winning Colors** (March 14, 1985 – February 17, 2008) was an
[American](/wiki/United_States "United States") [Hall of
Fame](/wiki/National_Museum_of_Racing_and_Hall_of_Fame "National Museum of
Racing and Hall of Fame") [Champion](/wiki/Eclipse_Award "Eclipse Award")
[Thoroughbred](/wiki/Thoroughbred "Thoroughbred")
[racehorse](/wiki/Horse_racing "Horse racing") and one of only three
[fillies](/wiki/Filly "Filly") to ever win the [Kentucky
Derby](/wiki/Kentucky_Derby "Kentucky Derby"). Though she was registered as
[roan](/wiki/Roan_\(horse\) "Roan \(horse\)"), she was, in fact, a
[gray](/wiki/Gray_\(horse\) "Gray \(horse\)") with a [white
blaze](/wiki/Horse_markings "Horse markings") on her face.

##
Background[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Winning_Colors_\(horse\)&action=edit&section=1
"Edit section: Background")]

Winning Colors was bred in Florida by Echo Valley Farm. During her racing
career she was owned by [Eugene V. Klein](/wiki/Eugene_V._Klein "Eugene V.
Klein") and trained by [D. Wayne Lukas](/wiki/D._Wayne_Lukas "D. Wayne
Lukas").

Her sire, Caro, was a top-class performer (rated 133 by
[Timeform](/wiki/Timeform "Timeform")), whose wins included the [Poule d'Essai
des Poulains](/wiki/Poule_d%27Essai_des_Poulains "Poule d'Essai des
Poulains"), [Prix Ganay](/wiki/Prix_Ganay "Prix Ganay") and [Prix
d'Ispahan](/wiki/Prix_d%27Ispahan "Prix d'Ispahan"), before becoming a very
successful breeding stallion. Caro's other progeny included
[Madelia](/wiki/Madelia_\(horse\) "Madelia \(horse\)"), [Crystal
Palace](/wiki/Crystal_Palace_\(horse\) "Crystal Palace \(horse\)"),
[Cozzene](/wiki/Cozzene "Cozzene") [Theia](/wiki/Theia_\(horse\) "Theia
\(horse\)") and [Siberian Express](/wiki/Siberian_Express_\(horse\) "Siberian
Express \(horse\)"). Winning Colors dam, All Rainbows won seven races and
finished third in the [Delaware Oaks](/wiki/Delaware_Oaks "Delaware Oaks").[2]
and was also a half-sister to [Chris Evert](/wiki/Chris_Evert_\(horse\) "Chris
Evert \(horse\)").[3]

## Racing
career[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Winning_Colors_\(horse\)&action=edit&section=2
"Edit section: Racing career")]

### 1987: two-year-old
season[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Winning_Colors_\(horse\)&action=edit&section=3
"Edit section: 1987: two-year-old season")]

Racing on the [West Coast of the United
States](/wiki/West_Coast_of_the_United_States "West Coast of the United
States") for trainer [D. Wayne Lukas](/wiki/D._Wayne_Lukas "D. Wayne Lukas"),
Winning Colors won both of her starts at age two.

### 1988: three-year-old
season[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Winning_Colors_\(horse\)&action=edit&section=4
"Edit section: 1988: three-year-old season")]

In the spring of [1988](/wiki/1988_in_sports "1988 in sports"), the large
filly won the [Santa Anita Derby](/wiki/Santa_Anita_Derby "Santa Anita
Derby"), defeating [colts](/wiki/Colt_\(horse\) "Colt \(horse\)") her age by
7½ lengths. Sent to [Churchill Downs](/wiki/Churchill_Downs "Churchill Downs")
for the Kentucky Derby, she was up against a stellar field of colts including
[Risen Star](/wiki/Risen_Star "Risen Star"), [Seeking the
Gold](/wiki/Seeking_the_Gold "Seeking the Gold"), [Forty
Niner](/wiki/Forty_Niner_\(horse\) "Forty Niner \(horse\)"), [Regal
Classic](/wiki/Regal_Classic "Regal Classic"), and co-favorite [Private
Terms](/wiki/Private_Terms "Private Terms"). As was her habit, Winning Colors
broke fast and raced to the lead. Although Forty Niner made a charge in the
homestretch, she held him off to win by a neck.

In the [Preakness Stakes](/wiki/Preakness_Stakes "Preakness Stakes"), the
second leg of the [U.S. Triple
Crown](/wiki/Triple_Crown_of_Thoroughbred_Racing "Triple Crown of Thoroughbred
Racing"), Winning Colors finished third to Risen Star, who then won the 1½
mile [Belmont Stakes](/wiki/Belmont_Stakes "Belmont Stakes") by fifteen
lengths while Winning Colors finished out of the money.

In the fall of 1988, Winning Colors finished second to [Ogden
Phipps'](/wiki/Ogden_Phipps "Ogden Phipps") filly [Personal
Ensign](/wiki/Personal_Ensign "Personal Ensign") in the [Maskette
Stakes](/wiki/Go_For_Wand_Handicap "Go For Wand Handicap"). The two fillies
next met in the [Breeders' Cup Distaff](/wiki/Breeders%27_Cup_Distaff
"Breeders' Cup Distaff") at Churchill Downs. Winning Colors had the lead with
10 yards to go when [Personal Ensign](/wiki/Personal_Ensign "Personal
Ensign"), who had struggled throughout the race because of the sloppy track,
rallied and won by what the U.S. Racing Hall of Fame describes as a "lip."
After the race, Winning Colors' trainer, D. Wayne Lukas, said that she had run
the best race of her career.

### 1989: four-year-old
season[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Winning_Colors_\(horse\)&action=edit&section=5
"Edit section: 1989: four-year-old season")]

In 1989 Winning Colors raced in her final campaign at age four and won two of
her seven races, hampered by [breathing difficulties](/wiki/Dyspnea "Dyspnea")
and [surgery](/wiki/Surgery "Surgery").

## Assessment and
honors[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Winning_Colors_\(horse\)&action=edit&section=6
"Edit section: Assessment and honors")]

Winning Colors was voted the 1988 [Eclipse Award for Outstanding 3-Year-Old
Filly](/wiki/Eclipse_Award_for_Outstanding_3-Year-Old_Filly "Eclipse Award for
Outstanding 3-Year-Old Filly").

In [2000](/wiki/2000_in_sports "2000 in sports"), Winning Colors was inducted
into the United States' [National Museum of Racing and Hall of
Fame](/wiki/National_Museum_of_Racing_and_Hall_of_Fame "National Museum of
Racing and Hall of Fame").

##
Retirement[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Winning_Colors_\(horse\)&action=edit&section=7
"Edit section: Retirement")]

As a broodmare, Winning Colors produced ten foals and six winners:

  * Shbakni, a brown filly, foaled in 1991, sired by [Mr Prospector](/wiki/Mr_Prospector "Mr Prospector"). Failed to win in 14 races.
  * Minden Rose, gray filly, 1992, by Mr Prospector. Won one race.[4]
  * Golden Colors, bay filly, 1993,by Mr Prospector. Won three races.[5]
  * Danzig Colors, bay filly, 1994, by [Danzig](/wiki/Danzig_\(horse\) "Danzig \(horse\)"). Won three races.[6]
  * Stormin Winnie, gray filly, 1995, by [Storm Cat](/wiki/Storm_Cat "Storm Cat"). Unraced.
  * Will Will Win, chestnut colt, 1996, by [Rahy](/wiki/Rahy "Rahy"). Won three races in South Africa.
  * Northwest Colors, bay filly, 1998, by [Broad Brush](/wiki/Broad_Brush "Broad Brush"). Won one race.[7]
  * Dr Litin, gray colt, 1999, by Broad Brush. Failed to win in three races.
  * Ocean Colors, gray filly, 2006, by Orientate. Won three races.[8]
  * Silver Colors, gray filly, 2007, by [Mr Greeley](/w/index.php?title=Mr_Greeley&action=edit&redlink=1 "Mr Greeley \(page does not exist\)"). Failed to win in four races.

Winning Colors was euthanized February 17, 2008, at the age of 23 as a result
of complications from [colic](/wiki/Horse_colic "Horse colic"). She was in
foal to Mr. Greeley. She is buried at Greentree Farm, a division of Gainesway
Farm near [Lexington, Kentucky](/wiki/Lexington,_Kentucky "Lexington,
Kentucky").[9]
